content: furrow socks handmade socks are one of life s true luxuries it s heavenly to wear a pair of socks made just to your own size specifications that are handcrafted from soft and luxurious yarns like alpaca and cashmere it s one of the best things about being a yarncrafter socks are also the perfect project to work on in warm weather or when traveling because they re small easy to manage and wonderfully portable the furrow socks pattern with its ribs reminiscent of the rolling row of a landscape full of freshly plowed fields in the spring provides the stretch needed for a crocheted sock s easy fit a satisfying texure that feels great on the soles and timeless style furrow socks skill level advanced beginner should be comfortable working in the round yarn 400-450 yards fingering/sock weight yarn preferably a variety of superwash wool variegated yarns work as well as tonal and solid varieties hook 3 5 mm/e hook or hook needed to obtain gauge size range adult x-small 7 5 bridge small 8 25 bridge medium 9 bridge large 9 75 bridge x- large 10 5 bridge notions 2 locking stitch markers in different colors tapestry needle for finishing gauge 4 single_crochet = 75 in toe section pattern notes read before beginning pattern  be sure to choose yarn that has a bouncier more elastic quality to it fibers like cotton silk and linen won t work well unless blended with another fiber with more stretch memory wools are good for this the more crimp there is in the base fiber the more bounce and stretch memory your fabric will offer a wool/nylon blend will offer extra durability as socks get a lot of hard wear and tear  the pattern is written with instructions for five adult sizes x-small small medium large x-large note that the size isn t determined by foot length but by the circumference of the foot around the bridge or widest part of the foot i wear a women s size us 9 shoe and my bridge is 9 around  don t see the size you need a feature of the pattern is that you can increase it up or down in size very easily all you need to do is keep the stitch count in a multiple of four from the toe on up through the leg and to just work the heel over one half of the round fabric tube make sure you do the math fig 1 furrow socks adjusted to baby size © figpox farms designs pg 2  this pattern is worked toe-up due to the nature of the crochet foundation chain top-down socks often don t have very much give to them and can cause constriction around the leg working toe-up allows for a stretchier cuff which is more forgiving to bigger legs  the toe portion of the pattern alternates increase rounds with rounds that maintain the stitch count this builds a deeper toe
